full_text:
JUS - Viewing Case Number 06049528 Page 3 of 3
PALM BEACH COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE OFFENSE REPORT CASE NO. 06049528 DISPOSITION: CLEARED BY
THEN FLED THE RESIDENCE ON FOOT TO THE NEIGHBOR'S HOUSE IN ORDER TO USE THE PHONE. RETRIEVED AND TOOK HER BACK TO THE RESIDENCE WHEN SHE AGAIN BEGAN FLAILING HER ARMS AND FIST WILDLY, STRIKING HIM AGAIN IN THE LEFT AND RIGHT FOREARM.
I THEN MADE CONTACT WITH WHO REPORTED THAT SHE HAD IN FACT HIT HER FATHER SEVERAL TIMES BECAUSE SHE HATES HIM.
UPON MAKING CONTACT WITH SHE WAS UNABLE TO STAND STRAIGHT, SLURRED HER SPEECH, AND HAD VERY RESTRICTED PUPILS. HOWEVER, SHE CONTINUALLY STATED THAT SHE WAS NOT UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ANY DRUG. AT THIS TIME, WAS PLACED INTO HANDCUFFS, WAS DOUBLELOCKED AND CHECKED FOR TIGHTNESS.
I THEN SPOKE WITH WHO REPORTED THAT SHE SAW TAKE APPROXIMATELY 2 1/2 XANAX BARS, WHILE PARTYING AT PALM BEACH COUNTY ESTATES, IN THE EARLY MORNING HOURS OF 033106. THEN STATED THAT AND HAVE BOTH BEEN TO HIGH RIDGE FOR DRUG USE, AND THEY HAVE BOTH BEEN USING NARCOTICS SINCE THE AGE OF 14. FURTHER EXPRESSED THAT HE NEEDED HELP IN LEARNING HOW TO CONTROL HIS DAUGHTERS.
WAS ISSUED INFORMATION ON THE PALM BEACH COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE YOUTH EAGLE ACADEMY PROGRAM. COMPLETED A SWORN WITNESS STATEMENT, WHICH WAS SUBMITTED TO THE PALM BEACH COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE. PHOTOGRAPHS OF DANIEL WERE NOT TAKEN AS HE HAD NO VISIBLE INJURY.
PROBABLE CAUSE SUPPLEMENTAL AND VICTIM NOTIFICATION FORM WERE COMPLETED ON SCENE. SIGNED FOR AND RECEIVED A COPY OF THE VICTIM'S RIGHTS BROCHURE. WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE JUVENILE ASSESSMENT CENTER BY D/S MONTI, ID 7346.
THIS CASE IS CLEARED BY ARREST AND THIS ENDS MY INVOLVEMENT IN THIS CASE AT THIS TIME.
D/S S. SHAFFER/ID 6376/TRANS: 040406/BH DICT: 040106/0900 HRS.
printed by Employee Id #: 4541 on April 05, 2006 04:
07/26/17 Page 95 of 124 Public Records Request No.: 17-295 DOJ-OGR-00031816

additional_notes: The document appears to be a scanned copy of an offense report from the Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office. The report details an incident involving a juvenile and her father. The document has been redacted in several areas to protect the identities of those involved. The report is dated April 5, 2006, and was printed by Employee ID #4541. The document also contains a public records request number and a date stamp of 07/26/17.
